transparency_law.name: Maryland Public Information Act
transparency_law.statute_citation: Maryland Code, General Provisions Article § 4-101 et seq.

response_requirements.initial_response_description: Custodian must grant or deny request within 30 days of receipt. If response will take more than 10 working days, must notify requester within 10 working days with anticipated timeline, estimated fee range, and reason for delay.
extension_conditions: If custodian reasonably believes response will take more than 10 working days, must notify requester within 10 days with timeline and estimated fees
response_requirements.no_response_consequence: Contact Public Access Ombudsman for mediation or file complaint with PIA Compliance Board

fee_structure.standard_copy_fee: Reasonable fees for search, preparation, and reproduction
fee_structure.search_time_fee: Reasonable fees for search and preparation
fee_structure.notes: Custodian may charge reasonable fees. PIA Compliance Board reviews unreasonable fees over $350.

exemptions.description: Trade secrets and proprietary business information

appeal_process.appeal_authority: Public Access Ombudsman or PIA Compliance Board
appeal_process.appeal_description: If denied or no response in 30 days: 1) Contact Public Access Ombudsman for mediation, 2) File complaint with PIA Compliance Board. Must consult ombudsman before filing board complaint.

penalties.civil: Board can order compliance or assess penalties

requester_requirements.specific_format: Written request recommended. No specific format required.
requester_requirements.notes: Broad public access granted. Any person may request.

specific_obligations: Provide 10-day notice if response will take longer
Provide written denial notice within 10 working days with reasons and review remedies

oversight_body.name: Public Access Ombudsman and PIA Compliance Board
oversight_body.role: Ombudsman mediates disputes. Board reviews formal complaints and can order compliance or assess penalties.
oversight_body.contact_info: Public Access Ombudsman, Office of Attorney General. Phone: (410) 576-6560. Email: pio.ombudsman@maryland.gov
enforcement_powers: Board: Review complaints about denials, unreasonable fees, failure to respond
Board: Order compliance or assess penalties

primary_sources: Maryland Code, General Provisions Article, Title 4
validation_metadata.verification_notes: Parsed from official statutory text file. Response time verified against canonical-values.json (30 business days). 5 exemptions parsed from statute summary.
